confession.seduction_context: She was distressed at the loss of a horse; the devil promised money to buy another horse, which turned out to be dung
powder_types: mixture of soot and animal fat
sabbat_activities: marriage feast for daughter of Jean Jacquat who married a young devil
typical feast where Scherre Austien was king

testimony.quarrel_subject: Her husband did not attend when community assembled, and no-one dared fine him for fear of his wife
Quarrel about carting wood to salines at Dieuze - she remarked to his servants that some still had to cart their wood from the woods, while hers was already at the salines

harms_alleged.time_after_quarrel: same year, after he struck her in the stomach

testimony.quarrel_subject: Story about community and how her husband mocked them - he had been sent to maire at Domnon to ask advice about fining him
Had not dared fine husband for fear of her
His animals strayed, and her boy threatened his niece
She had taken his horse, which she found in her field of oats; he sent his wife to recover it, since she spoke German, but accused would not accept his caution
Her husband refused to sell them some grain

harms_alleged.time_after_quarrel: 12 years earlier - sudden wind assailed witness when accused moved away

testimony.quarrel_subject: Accused came asking for some 'picatte', but servant said she did not have keys to cellar

harms_alleged.time_after_quarrel: 5 years before - servant claimed Senelle climbed through window, jumped on her bed, and gave her a drink

testimony.quarrel_subject: She tried to use their washing water and they protested. She had been angry, saying what they really meant was that their bodies were 'plus beaue et plus famée que le sien'
testimony.threat_quote: plus beaue et plus famée que le sien

harms_alleged.time_after_quarrel: 10 years earlier - saw a strange blue light come into room and then weigh down on them
10 years earlier - strange blue light incident

testimony.quarrel_subject: Repeated husband's deposition about straying horse
Her mother said that Senelle was cause of death, and hated her because she had taken keeping of calves away from her

timeline.subject: Senelle Enguers
timeline.details: No reproaches, but constantly denied that she was a witch

timeline.subject: Senelle Enguers
timeline.details: Said she was over 50; denied charges, insisted they were based on hearsay

timeline.subject: Senelle Enguers
timeline.details: PG (Maimbourg) asks that she be presented to the torture

timeline.subject: Senelle Enguers
timeline.details: Brief record of further interrogation in prison at Dieuze; she maintained denials

timeline.subject: Senelle Enguers
timeline.details: Maimbourg wrote from Lunéville to say that as she has twice resisted the torture she should be renvoyée (released). Husband had to guarantee payment of costs

timeline.subject: Senelle Enguers
timeline.details: Substitut for PG asks that she be called in, according to terms of previous sentence. Has been accused by Charles Austien of Loudrefing, recently executed at Biderstroff

timeline.subject: Senelle Enguers
timeline.details: Second round of witness depositions (now stated to be widow, accused by Scherr Austien)

timeline.subject: Senelle Enguers
timeline.details: Said she was about 60; knew she was accused of witchcraft

timeline.subject: Senelle Enguers
timeline.details: No reproaches, but denied all charges

timeline.subject: Senelle Enguers
timeline.details: Rémy asks for question ordinaire et extraordinaire

timeline.subject: Senelle Enguers
timeline.details: Change de Nancy approves moderate torture only, in view of age and 'caducité'

timeline.subject: Senelle Enguers
timeline.details: Interrogation under torture; confessed to witchcraft after torture

timeline.subject: Senelle Enguers
timeline.details: Change de Nancy asks that she should confirm confessions freely, then approves death sentence

torture.requesting_official: Rémy (Nicolas Rémy, likely the famous witch-hunter)
torture.restrictions: moderate torture only, in view of age and 'caducité'

accomplices_named.name: Scherre Austien (Charles Austien)
accomplices_named.context: Named as king at sabbat feast; was the one who accused her in 1594

accomplices_named.name: Jean Jacquat
accomplices_named.context: Named as accomplice; held marriage feast for his daughter who married a young devil

accomplices_named.name: Jehenne femme du Sellier
accomplices_named.context: Named as accomplice who helped her kill a horse; had discharged her because they made a pact not to accuse one another

prior_accusations.context: Recently executed at Biderstroff; accused her before his execution

notable_quotes.speaker: Le petit Frantz
notable_quotes.french: Thought she was good woman, and had only seen 'tout plaisir et amitie' in her
notable_quotes.english: Thought she was a good woman, and had only seen all pleasure and friendship in her
notable_quotes.context: One witness who spoke in her favor during first trial

notable_quotes.speaker: Senelle Enguers
notable_quotes.french: et que Dieu ne scavoit sceu garder des meschantes langues et qu'a grande peine s'en scauroit elle garder
notable_quotes.english: and that God could not guard himself from evil tongues and that she could hardly guard herself from them
notable_quotes.context: Her defense during interrogation about why she was so feared

notable_quotes.speaker: Senelle Enguers
notable_quotes.french: estoit bien peu hardie de gaiger son marit pour l'amende de communauté quant il n'y sy trouvoit, redoubtant une femme, requerant a Messieurs sieurs de Justices que tous ceulx dudit Guinzeling qui la soubsonnent pour une sorciere fussent prins et constituez prisonniers tant et sy longuement qu'ilz n'avoient faict apparence suffisament a droict qu'elle soit telle, et signamment prouvé les faicts de sortillege qu'ilz luy ont veue faire
notable_quotes.english: the community was very cowardly to fine her husband for the community fine when he wasn't there, fearing a woman, requesting that Justices have all those from Guinzeling who suspect her of being a witch be imprisoned as long as they have not made sufficient appearance in law that she is such, and specifically proved the acts of sorcery that they have seen her do
notable_quotes.context: Her bold defense during interrogation, demanding her accusers prove their charges

notable_quotes.speaker: Alyson femme Michiel
notable_quotes.french: plus beaue et plus famée que le sien
notable_quotes.english: more beautiful and more famous than hers
notable_quotes.context: Quote from accused during quarrel about washing water

notable_quotes.speaker: Gros Michiel (via witness)
notable_quotes.french: Vay tu sorciere, tu m'as desja assé faict de dommage par cy devant, mais sy tu me fais encore mourir ce cheval icy, je te feray brusler ou je brusleray
notable_quotes.english: Go you witch, you have already done me enough damage before, but if you cause me to lose this horse here, I will have you burned or I will burn
notable_quotes.context: Gros Michiel calling her a witch and threatening to have her burned

relationships.evidence_text: Alyson femme Michiel; her husband (Gros Michiel)
Annel femme du precedent (Geoffroy Pérot Sellier)
she (as neighbour) made remark to his servants

economic_context.details: Multiple disputes involving straying animals, grain sales, access to resources (picatte from cellar), and economic losses - animals worth 300 florins, 100 ecus mentioned. Witness 37's mother hated accused because she had taken keeping of calves away from her. Trial costs had to be guaranteed by her husband after first release.

harms_catalog.precipitating_quarrel: Quarrel about carting wood to salines at Dieuze - she made remark about wood already being at salines; witness struck her in stomach
Quarrel about wood carting; witness struck her
His animals strayed, and her boy threatened his niece
She had taken his horse, which she found in her field of oats; dispute about recovering it

harms_catalog.harm_description: sortit de son bon sang (lost her good blood/health), had to be taken to feste at Vergaville
harms_catalog.precipitating_quarrel: Accused visited her when ill and said she should seek a remedy; witness did not respond because she feared her
harms_catalog.time_between_quarrel_and_harm: as accused moved away a sudden wind assailed witness

harms_catalog.precipitating_quarrel: Her husband refused to sell them some grain

harms_catalog.victim_name: Servant of Elizabeth femme au vieulx Haman
harms_catalog.harm_description: Servant became ill, claimed Senelle climbed through window, jumped on her bed, gave her a drink; vomited up black matter
harms_catalog.precipitating_quarrel: Accused came asking for some 'picatte', but servant said she did not have keys to cellar
harms_catalog.time_between_quarrel_and_harm: 5 years before - witness returned from marriage feast to find servant ill
10 years earlier; died at same time

harms_catalog.victim_name: Alyson femme Michiel and Kinio femme Graveskopff
harms_catalog.harm_description: Strange blue light came into room and weighed down on them
harms_catalog.precipitating_quarrel: She tried to use their washing water and they protested; she was angry about being told their bodies were more beautiful and famous than hers
harms_catalog.time_between_quarrel_and_harm: 10 years earlier - incident occurred after quarrel previous day

harms_catalog.victim_name: Mother of Alyson femme Bernard Mathieu
harms_catalog.precipitating_quarrel: Mother said that Senelle was cause of death, and hated her because she had taken keeping of calves away from her
harms_catalog.time_between_quarrel_and_harm: 10 years before - mother stated this on her deathbed

harms_catalog.harm_description: Deaths of horses in two separate incidents
Foal attacked and bitten by a large black horse, after which it died
harms_catalog.method_alleged: large black horse (devil in horse form per confession)

harms_catalog.precipitating_quarrel: Argument with husband about a mare he had bought, because he did not want to pass on foal
harms_catalog.time_between_quarrel_and_harm: after he had to pass on the foal

harms_catalog.harm_description: One of his horses was dead
harms_catalog.precipitating_quarrel: Implied trespass - she had passed by his window
harms_catalog.time_between_quarrel_and_harm: within a quarter of an hour

material_culture.context: Accused came asking for some from witness's cellar
Witness's husband refused to sell them some grain
Quarrel about accused trying to use their washing water
Taking cartload of wood to salines at Dieuze
Confessed to being carried off on spindle to make hail

material_culture.object: powder made from soot and animal fat
candles made from hands of stillborn children
material_culture.context: Confessed to making candles from hands, lit in name of devil
Admitted she had kept the communion host and thrown it away

spatial_references.context: Primary location of trial; residence of accused and most witnesses
Salines at Dieuze where wood was carted; prison location
Where maire was consulted; location of marriage feast; residence of accomplice Kethel
Where witness had to be taken to feste after illness
Cemetery 6 km away where they took 2 stillborn children to make powder
Residence of Charles Austien who accused her
Residence of accomplices Jean Jacquat and Jean hardier du rouge bestail
Salt works at Dieuze where wood was delivered
Where accused's husband watched community assembly from window
Accused's field where witness's horse strayed
Where stillborn children were taken from to make powder

economic_hardship_indicators: Multiple animal deaths causing economic hardship
Trial costs had to be guaranteed by husband
Disputes over resources (grain, picatte, straying animals)
Value of lost animals: 300 florins, 100 ecus

prior_legal_disputes.description: Accused's husband did not attend community assemblies and no one dared fine him for fear of his wife
prior_legal_disputes.outcome: Community sought advice from maire at Domnon about fining him

prior_legal_disputes.description: Gros Michiel called her witch and threatened to have her burned; she took him before maire
prior_legal_disputes.outcome: He said he did not know what he had said, being drunk

legal_context.redress_outcome: Gros Michiel claimed he was drunk and did not know what he had said

hearsay_chains.content: he suspected her over death of two horses after occasions when he had found her in his stable
his master and mistress suspected her over death of a horse
Senelle was cause of death, and hated her because she had taken keeping of calves away from her

emotional_state_notes: said accusers would be damned while she would die innocent

reproaches_to_witnesses.objection: Said at one point that a group of witnesses had nothing but hearsay to report, and a man should not drive his wife out for that
Continued to deny charges, insisting that they were based on hearsay
Said that jeune Haman had killed his horses in doing carting for the salines
Said Adolph Michiel could not prove she had caused death of his horses; also that she often passed his windows

third_parties.name: le jeune Enguers
third_parties.context: Husband of accused; had disputes with witnesses; did not attend community assemblies; had to guarantee payment of trial costs after first release

third_parties.name: Stoffel (hardier des porcs)
third_parties.context: Hardier des porcs of Guinzeling, who made himself partie formelle against her; initiated first trial

third_parties.name: servant of Elizabeth femme au vieulx Haman
third_parties.context: Became ill after accused allegedly climbed through window, jumped on bed, and gave her a drink

third_parties.name: escorcheur
third_parties.context: Had come to deal with dead horse; called accused witch as she passed

third_parties.name: Gros Michiel (Adolph Michiel)
third_parties.context: Called her witch and threatened to have her burned; was taken before maire by accused; claimed he was drunk

third_parties.name: son of Senelle Enguers
third_parties.context: Called her witch at Easter 1594; was excluded from church by curé

third_parties.name: daughter-in-law of Senelle Enguers
third_parties.context: Called her witch at Easter 1594; was excluded from church by curé

third_parties.name: curé of Guinzeling
third_parties.context: Excluded son and daughter-in-law from church until they forgave one another

third_parties.name: mother of Alyson femme Bernard Mathieu
third_parties.context: On deathbed said that Senelle was cause of death, hated her for taking keeping of calves away

third_parties.name: Charles Austien (Scherr Austien)
third_parties.context: From Loudrefing, recently executed at Biderstroff; accused her before his execution in 1594

extraction_metadata.notes: This is a complex two-part trial spanning 10 years. First trial in 1584-1585 ended with release after she resisted torture twice. Second trial in 1594 initiated after she was accused by recently executed Charles Austien. Notable features: strong community fear of accused, exclusion from church by curé, accused's own children calling her witch, extensive testimony about animal deaths (especially horses), and ultimate confession under torture naming multiple accomplices. The trial shows interesting legal procedure including cost guarantees and conditional release terms.
